intro: Galium brevifolium subsp. insulare, commonly known as the island bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are usually rounded or heart-shaped, with a hairy surface. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
